text: Hey all... can you help me with my MTG terminology... A "Spell Slinger" deck... is it simply a deck that runs an abundance of instants and sorceries, or is it a deck that is able to cast several spells per turn? Thanx in advance all!
The former
agreed
more specifically I would define it as a deck that has the primary goal of interacting with the game through instant and sorcery spells
rock on, that's what I was thinkin'. Thanx!
BTW, WotC uses the spelling 'spellslinger'
So no space
lol. nice call Henry... thank you for being proactive on the editing. :slightly_smiling_face:

text: Sunforger is the greatest. Sadly, most Boros combinations don’t have a big pull for me.
I think we had this conversation recently, didn't we? After considering it, I'm cautious about Sunforger, because it's pretty clunky to use.

You have to build around it, but if you do, it's very rewarding. Buddy of mine has a Bruse/Akiri deck and nearly every spell in his deck is Sunforger-able, which makes him constantly threatening. Can't attack him, he's got too many fogs. Can't destroy his stuff, he's got protection effects and Wild Ricochet. Can't wrath, he'll give his stuff indestructible with Boros Charm. Can't let him through unblocked, he'll give his commander double strike with Boros Charm and commander damage you out of the game.
But it's a one-shot unless he has ways (and the right mana) to re-equip after a use.

It's an equipment deck, he's got ways. Really it's a threat-of-activation thing. All he has to do is keep up two mana and he has a response to any nasty thing an opponent tries to pull, whether it be a Wrath, spot removal, a combo, or an all-out-assault. That kind of versatility is a powerful deterrent
Merciless Eviction...
or in Green it falls to [[!Krosan Grip]]

attachments.fallback: <https://img.scryfall.com/cards/large/en/c15/189.jpg?1496445155>
attachments.title: Krosan Grip

text:
Merciless eviction? Teferi's Protection
Krosan Grip is one of the few ways around it, yes
There are several common ways around, but I'm not arguing it isn't strong, but only really in equipment-themed decks.
Sunforger is excellent when built around . . . But I can’t ever justify building a deck around a card I’ll see at best every third game. Personally I’d rather run cards that are always useful.
I built Oros as Voltron with a Sunforger package.
If I never see Sunforger all of those instants are still good value.
Though you’re probably fine not even building around Sunforger. Just grabbing a chaos warp you’d run anyway is generally worth
Yeah
And once I do get Sunforger all of that equipment stuff is good to pull out Swords of X and Y, etc.
Path, Swords, Wear/Tear, Boros Charm, Teferi's Protection, Wild Ricochet, Chaos Warp, there's a lot to like
Hide//Seek
So much mana though
That's kind of looking at it the wrong way, though. Sunforger is about responding to bad stuff, not unequip-re-equiping it over and over
threat of activation
Puresteel Paladin, Leonin Shikari, and Hammer of Nazahn/Sigarda's Aid help get around that.
Joey has it right.
Don't unequip, if you don't have to.
Well it’s obviously good in an equipment deck
Not necessarily.
You dilute your equipment package with Sunforger targets
It still has to be built around.
I just don’t buy that it’s that amazing outside those select places. I see it played badly or in decks that don’t use it well way more than the opposite
Also [[Valorous Stance]] has been a house.

text:
How many cards is diluting anyways?
I feel like the targets you’d want would be played regardless
I generally love seeing Sunforger as it almost always means someone is gonna spend a ton of mana showing off their Sunforger
Probably nothing significant. Maybe 5-10 depending, Mason

I think this is a analogous with the "Delver of Secrets" discussion players constantly have with Maro. Players allege that it's too good and fail to realize that it requires a very particular type of deckbuilding. The choices you make happen in deck construction, not so much in the game, but most players only think about the choices that happen in the game. 

Sunforger is kinda the same way. If you just throw it in, it's gonna be bad. You should build around it with care and use its effects wisely if you're going to actually get proper use out of it
Sure - it’s a specific deck in Boros that can dedicate the 8 mana it requires to use.
If you build around it, you probably need to run Tithe and Mistveil Plains, two things you might not have played otherwise
my buddy who runs Sunforger does indeed use Mistveil Plains
Tithe is so good that you probably should be playing it in Boros period
Not an easy card to find though
And one I’d guess more players than not don’t know exists
There are plenty of easier to find things.
Oreskos Explorer is fantastic. Sword of the Animist. Knight of the White Orchid.
"Oreskos Explorer is fantastic" sounds like the next thing we're all about to start debating
I can't say I agree on that one
Okay, to hand is not great, but it's still a good card.

text: I feel like Explorer is better as it comes attached to a body. I know you have the potential to hit fewer lands, but still.

Body is great if you have a plan to utilize that. IMO people sometimes overvalue a body just because they’ve heard it’s valuable
In a pinch you can always suit it up.
Not saying you’re doing that here
I'm not running many creatures, so I'd run this over Gift and then I can start putting swords on a cheap, inconsequential body.

Depends on the effect attached to the body. ETB effects on a body are great because you get a blocker and a spell. If it's a continuous value effect, though (like drawing extra cards or something) it's risky because it's Wrath-able
I’d argue people overrate chumps in edh fairly often too lol
